page.title: 14WADWORTH VILLAGE
page.content: Wadworth village can boast many fine buildings , not least of these is Wadworth church.It is built on the top of the hill and has a commanding view of the surrounding countryside.Another of these buildings is Wadworth hall. Built behind the church in 1750 it is a fine example of Georgian architecture. Situated at the bottom of Carr lane is Wadworth manor house. It was originally built around 1450 but was pulled down since but has been rebuilt by Donald Butler. The White Hart is one of the two village pubs and was once a coaching inn. It stands on the same side of the road as the manor house. Opposite the White Hart is The Fox and Hounds it is the second of the village pubs. In front of the White Hart is the old maypole it was an old tram pole erected at the time the motorway was built.
